summary.long: Colossians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the saints and faithful brothers and sisters in Christ who are at Colossae: Grace to you and peace from God our Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We give thanks to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and the love which you have for all the saints;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of the hope reserved for you in heaven, of which you previously heard in the word of truth, the gospel
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which has come to you, just as in all the world also it is bearing fruit and increasing, even as it has been doing in you also since the day you heard it and understood the grace of God in truth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as you learned it from Epaphras, our beloved fellow bond-servant, who is a faithful servant of Christ on our behalf,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he also informed us of your love in the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason we also, since the day we heard about it, have not ceased praying for you and asking that you may be filled with the knowledge of His will in all spiritual wisdom and understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you will walk in a manner worthy of the Lord, to please Him in all respects, bearing fruit in every good work and increasing in the knowledge of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: strengthened with all power, according to His glorious might, for the attaining of all perseverance and patience; joyously
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: giving thanks to the Father, who has qualified us to share in the inheritance of the saints in light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He rescued us from the domain of darkness, and transferred us to the kingdom of His beloved Son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of all creation:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for by Him all things were created, both in the heavens and on earth, visible and invisible, whether thrones, or dominions, or rulers, or authorities—all things have been created through Him and for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is before all things, and in Him all things hold together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is also the head of the body, the church; and He is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, so that He Himself will come to have first place in everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it was the Father’s good pleasure for all the fullness to dwell in Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and through Him to reconcile all things to Himself, whether things on earth or things in heaven, having made peace through the blood of His cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And although you were previously alienated and hostile in attitude, engaged in evil deeds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet He has now reconciled you in His body of flesh through death, in order to present you before Him holy and blameless and beyond reproach—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if indeed you continue in the faith firmly established and steadfast, and not shifting from the hope of the gospel that you have heard, which was proclaimed in all creation under heaven, and of which I, Paul, was made a minister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I rejoice in my sufferings for your sake, and in my flesh I am supplementing what is lacking in Christ’s afflictions in behalf of His body, which is the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was made a minister of this church according to the commission from God granted to me for your benefit, so that I might fully carry out the preaching of the word of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that is, the mystery which had been hidden from the past ages and generations, but now has been revealed to His saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom God willed to make known what the wealth of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles is, the mystery that is Christ in you, the hope of glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We proclaim Him, admonishing every person and teaching every person with all wisdom, so that we may present every person complete in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this purpose I also labor, striving according to His power which works mightily within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I want you to know how great a struggle I have in your behalf and for those who are at Laodicea, and for all those who have not personally seen my face,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that their hearts may be encouraged, having been knit together in love, and that they would attain to all the wealth that comes from the full assurance of understanding, resulting in a true knowledge of God’s mystery, that is, Christ Himself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say this so that no one will deceive you with persuasive arguments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even though I am absent in body, I am nevertheless with you in spirit, rejoicing to see your orderly manner and the stability of your faith in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, as you have received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk in Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having been firmly rooted and now being built up in Him and established in your faith, just as you were instructed, and overflowing with gratitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See to it that there is no one who takes you captive through philosophy and empty deception in accordance with human tradition, in accordance with the elementary principles of the world, rather than in accordance with Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Him all the fullness of Deity dwells in bodily form,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in Him you have been made complete, and He is the head over every ruler and authority;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in Him you were also circumcised with a circumcision performed without hands, in the removal of the body of the flesh by the circumcision of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having been buried with Him in baptism, in which you were also raised with Him through faith in the working of God, who raised Him from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you were dead in your wrongdoings and the uncircumcision of your flesh, He made you alive together with Him, having forgiven us all our wrongdoings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having canceled the certificate of debt consisting of decrees against us, which was hostile to us; and He has taken it out of the way, having nailed it to the cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had disarmed the rulers and authorities, He made a public display of them, having triumphed over them through Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, no one is to act as your judge in regard to food and drink, or in respect to a festival or a new moon, or a Sabbath day—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: things which are only a shadow of what is to come; but the substance belongs to Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take care that no one keeps defrauding you of your prize by delighting in humility and the worship of the angels, taking his stand on visions he has seen, inflated without cause by his fleshly mind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not holding firmly to the head, from whom the entire body, being supplied and held together by the joints and ligaments, grows with a growth which is from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you have died with Christ to the elementary principles of the world, why, as if you were living in the world, do you submit yourself to decrees, such as,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not handle, do not taste, do not touch!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (which all refer to things destined to perish with use)—in accordance with the commandments and teachings of man?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are matters which do have the appearance of wisdom in self-made religion and humility and severe treatment of the body, but are of no value against fleshly indulgence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if you have been raised with Christ, keep seeking the things that are above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set your minds on the things that are above, not on the things that are on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have died, and your life is hidden with Christ in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Christ, who is our life, is revealed, then you also will be revealed with Him in glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, treat the parts of your earthly body as dead to sexual immorality, impurity, passion, evil desire, and greed, which amounts to idolatry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is because of these things that the wrath of God is coming upon the sons of disobedience,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in them you also once walked, when you were living in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now you also, rid yourselves of all of them: anger, wrath, malice, slander, and obscene speech from your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not lie to one another, since you stripped off the old self with its evil practices,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have put on the new self, which is being renewed to a true knowledge according to the image of the One who created it—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a renewal in which there is no distinction between Greek and Jew, circumcised and uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian, slave, and free, but Christ is all, and in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, as those who have been chosen of God, holy and beloved, put on a heart of compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bearing with one another, and forgiving each other, whoever has a complaint against anyone; just as the Lord forgave you, so must you do also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In addition to all these things put on love, which is the perfect bond of unity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the peace of Christ, to which you were indeed called in one body, rule in your hearts; and be thankful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the word of Christ richly dwell within you, with all wisdom teaching and admonishing one another with psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing with thankfulness in your hearts to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever you do in word or deed, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks through Him to God the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wives, be subject to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husbands, love your wives and do not become bitter against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children, obey your parents in everything, for this is pleasing to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fathers, do not antagonize your children, so that they will not become discouraged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slaves, obey those who are your human masters in everything, not with eye-service, as people-pleasers, but with sincerity of heart, fearing the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever you do, do your work heartily, as for the Lord and not for people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that it is from the Lord that you will receive the reward of the inheritance. It is the Lord Christ whom you serve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the one who does wrong will receive the consequences of the wrong which he has done, and that without partiality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Masters, grant your slaves justice and fairness, knowing that you also have a Master in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Devote yourselves to prayer, keeping alert in it with an attitude of thanksgiving;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: praying at the same time for us as well, that God will open up to us a door for the word, so that we may proclaim the mystery of Christ, for which I have also been imprisoned;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I may make it clear in the way that I ought to proclaim it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Conduct yourselves with wisdom toward outsiders, making the most of the opportunity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your speech must always be with grace, as though seasoned with salt, so that you will know how you should respond to each person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As to all my affairs, Tychicus, our beloved brother and faithful servant and fellow bond-servant in the Lord, will bring you information.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have sent him to you for this very purpose, that you may know about our circumstances and that he may encourage your hearts;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with him is Onesimus, our faithful and beloved brother, who is one of your own. They will inform you about the whole situation here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, sends you his greetings; and also Barnabas’ cousin Mark (about whom you received instructions; if he comes to you, welcome him);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also Jesus who is called Justus; these are the only fellow workers for the kingdom of God who are from the circumcision, and they have proved to be an encouragement to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Epaphras, who is one of your own, a bond-servant of Christ Jesus, sends you his greetings, always striving earnestly for you in his prayers, that you may stand mature and fully assured in all the will of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I testify for him that he has a deep concern for you and for those who are in Laodicea and Hierapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Luke, the beloved physician, sends you his greetings, and Demas does also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet the brothers and sisters who are in Laodicea and also Nympha and the church that is in her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When this letter is read among you, have it also read in the church of the Laodiceans; and you, for your part, read my letter that is coming from Laodicea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell Archippus, “See to the ministry which you have received in the Lord, so that you may fulfill it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, write this greeting with my own hand. Remember my imprisonment. Grace be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
